text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that in the American system, the copyright holder could choose to pursue actual damages or statutory damages. The candidate answer mentions statutory damages in the US section: \"No registration needed for suit, but registering with USCO (pre- or post-infringement) unlocks statutory damages ($750\u2013150K per work) and attorney fees.\" However, it fails to explicitly mention the option to pursue *actual damages* alongside statutory damages, which is a key component of the required statement under US law (17 U.S.C. \u00a7 504(a)).", "criterion_id": "661ecb64-b694-403f-97ea-781b4eca98f4"}
